H0.text: Light is the source of energy for the endothermic reaction of photosynthesis.

H1.text: Wind is the source of energy for the endothermic reaction of photosynthesis.

H2.text: Electricity is the source of energy for photosynthesis, an endothermic reaction.

H3.text: Air is the source of energy for photosynthesis, which is an endothermic reaction.

A4.text: Photosynthesis ( FOH-tə-SINTH-ə-sis) is a system of biological processes by which photopigment-bearing autotrophic organisms, such as most plants, algae and cyanobacteria, convert light energy — typically from sunlight — into the chemical energy necessary to fuel their metabolism.
